args.natural_language_statement: Let P be a permutation matrix. Prove that det(P) ∈ { -1,1 }, i.e. it is either -1 or 1. Do this without using the Laplace formula. Provide Lean4 statement (no proof) that compiles and faithfully expresses the claim. End the theorem with := by sorry. Include necessary imports (import Mathlib) and definitions so the statement compiles.

retrieved_examples.nl: If σ is a permutation of fin n, then the determinant of the corresponding permutation matrix equals the sign of σ.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

open Matrix

variable {R : Type*} [CommRing R]

theorem det_permutation_matrix {n : Type*} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n] (σ : Perm n) :
  Matrix.det (Matrix.of fun i j => if j = σ i then (1 : R) else 0) = (Equiv.sign σ : R) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Equiv Matrix

variable {R : Type*} [CommRing R]

/-- The determinant of the permutation matrix associated to a permutation `σ` equals the sign of `σ`,
    viewed as an element of the base ring `R`. -/
theorem det_perm_matrix_eq_sign {n : Type*} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n] (σ : Perm n) :
  Matrix.det (Matrix.of fun i j => if j = σ i then (1 : R) else 0) = (Equiv.sign σ : R) := by sorry

/-- In particular, the determinant of a permutation matrix is either `1` or `-1`. -/
theorem det_perm_matrix_is_plus_minus_one {n : Type*} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n] (σ : Perm n) :
  Matrix.det (Matrix.of fun i j => if j = σ i then (1 : R) else 0) = (1 : R) ∨
    Matrix.det (Matrix.of fun i j => if j = σ i then (1 : R) else 0) = - (1 : R) := by sorry

args.query: Perm.sign Equiv.sign Mathlib4 sign permutation matrix Perm.sign

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Matrix

variable {n : Type*} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]

/-- The determinant of a permutation matrix (with integer entries 0/1) is either `1` or `-1`. -/
theorem det_perm_matrix_is_plus_minus_one_int (σ : Perm n) :
  Matrix.det (Matrix.of fun i j => if j = σ i then (1 : Int) else 0) = 1 ∨
    Matrix.det (Matrix.of fun i j => if j = σ i then (1 : Int) else 0) = -1 := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Matrix

variable {n : Type*} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]

/-- The determinant of the permutation matrix associated to a bijection `σ : n ≃ n` (entries in Z)
    is either `1` or `-1`. -/
theorem det_perm_matrix_is_plus_minus_one_int (σ : n ≃ n) :
  Matrix.det (Matrix.of fun i j => if j = σ i then (1 : Int) else 0) = 1 ∨
    Matrix.det (Matrix.of fun i j => if j = σ i then (1 : Int) else 0) = -1 := by sorry
